SENT.plain: Two females patients suffering from BehÃ§et syndrome were treated by manual plasmapheresis
A total of eight (8) sessions were performed in both patients
In each session, about 800 cm.3 of blood were depurated , without plasmatic replacement
In no case other therapeutic methods were used neither during nor after plasmapheresis
There was a rapid improvement of all clinical manifestations, which became particularly evident after the 3.rd session
Lesions were completely healed in both patients by the end of treatment
Laboratory data became normal or nearly normal, namely: fibrinogen, syderemia and plasma fibrinolytic activity
In the two years follow-up, patients have been well and free of symptoms with the exception of some episodic crisis of little oral aphtae of short duration
